column4: Hi,i'm using ubuntu 10.10. trying to install Libre Office. But when i double click on the .deb package, it is opening with the software center instead of package manager. Help me how open it with package manager
u can do the installation with software center as well.Both will do almost same job
no, i'm not able to do it
the install button in software is disabled
tell the package name
say the package
Libre Office, i downloaded it from another computer
u can do the installation with terminal easily
do u know how to add ppa
nope
cant me make it to open it with the synaptic installer
wait
http://www.webupd8.org/2011/01/install-libreoffice-in-ubuntu-from.html
u can do install that if u have administrative right
i know it, when i double click ,it will ask for admin password to install.But here it is not opening with synaptic installer
I am also have the same problem,so I tried with terminal by adding PPA.U can also do it if u have an internet connection
if no net then go to the directory where the package downloaded then run this command in terminal sudo dpkg -i package.deb
Libre office is not a single deb file. it contains many small deb files
so does the command work
i told u this same prob happened to me.what I did was with PPA
may somebody here can help u
arunkumar413; new idea. To install Libre office, first u have to remove oppen office
follow this http://www.ubuntugeek.com/how-to-install-libreoffice-in-ubuntu-using-deb-packages.html
